title: RFC: Chat Agent Queued Messages â€“ Service-Based Queuing Architecture
author: digitarald
body:
# Chat Agent Queued Messages â€“ Implementation Plan

## Summary
Enable queued user messages in the chat experience using a service-based architecture. While a chat request is in progress, additional submissions are queued (not lost), surfaced via a status bar indicator, and automatically dispatched as a single numbered Markdown list when the current request completes. Attachments from only the most recent queued message are retained. Execution context (mode, model, tools) is taken at flush time. Implementation follows existing VS Code patterns (services, disposables, observables, status bar contributions) and ships incrementally.

## Goals
- Let users continue writing during long-running executions without losing input.
- Minimal, unobtrusive visibility of pending prompts (status bar first; optional widget later).
- Automatic, reliable flush with correct context (mode/model/tools) at time of send.
- Preserve accessibility, telemetry, attachment semantics.
- Adhere to VS Code architectural & layering conventions for maintainability.

## Non-Goals
- Terminal / inline chat queuing (initially).
- Editing / reordering / deletion of individual queued items.
- Provider API or chat service contract changes.
- Unlimited queue size or large binary attachment aggregation in v1.

## Key Decisions
1. Service-based: `IChatQueueService` for cross-cutting queue state.
2. Universal queuing (any mode) to avoid mode-conditional logic.
3. Aggregation: single numbered Markdown list (1., 2., ...).
4. Attachment policy: only latest message's attachments applied at flush.
5. Context capture: evaluate mode/model/tools at flush, not per message.
6. Limits: max 5 messages, 10 KB each, 50 KB total per session.

## User Experience Flow
1. User submits while request in progress â†’ input clears â†’ status bar shows `$(clock) n`.
2. Tooltip: localized summary; optional command to inspect (future).
3. When request finishes (or is canceled), queue auto-flushes; status clears.
4. Screen reader announcements for "message queued" and "queued messages sent".

## Architecture Overview
- Files:
  - Interface: `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatQueueService.ts`
  - Impl: `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatQueueServiceImpl.ts`
  - Registration: `chat.contribution.ts` (singleton, delayed instantiation)
  - Status Bar: `chatQueueStatus.ts`
  - Widget integration (optional phase 2): `chatContentParts/ChatQueuedMessagesWidget` (not in v1)
- Core methods: `queueMessage(sessionId, text, attachments)`, `flushQueue(sessionId)`, `clearQueue(sessionId)`, `getQueueLength(sessionId)`
- Event: `onDidChangeQueue` emits `{ sessionId, length }` with debounce for UI efficiency.

## ChatWidget Integration (v1)
- Constructor: inject `@IChatQueueService`.
- Subscribe to `onDidChangeQueue` â†’ update tooltip / context.
- Subscribe to `chatService.requestInProgressObs` â†’ trigger flush when false.
- `_acceptInput`: if request in progress â†’ queue (text + attachments), clear editor, fire existing accept event, do not send.
- Helpers: `maybeFlushQueue(sessionId)`, `updateSubmitButtonTooltip(count)`.

## Flush Logic
- Trigger: first transition of global `requestInProgress` to false with non-empty queue.
- Combine queued texts -> numbered Markdown list (blank line between items, trim whitespace).
- Use only latest message attachments.
- Clear queue pre-send to avoid duplication; on failure optionally restore or notify.

## Memory & Lifecycle
- Enforce per-message and total-text limits; truncate with ellipsis.
- Remove oldest messages when exceeding limits.
- Clear queues on session disposal (`chatService.onDidDisposeSession`).
- Detach all attachment references on clear for GC friendliness.

## Accessibility
- Announce queued additions (single vs multiple).
- Announce flush completion with message count.
- Status bar entry has ARIA label reflecting current count.

## Telemetry (Tentative)
Event: `chat.queueFlush`
- `messageCount`, `totalCharacters`, `hadAttachments` (boolean)
- Classification: System metadata (performance & feature usage).

## Status Bar (Phase 1 UI)
- Entry: `$(clock) <count>` right-aligned.
- Tooltip: localized summary; if feasible, preview first N chars of first & last item.
- Disposal when count=0.

## Optional Phase 2: Sticky Widget
- Only if status bar visibility insufficient per feedback.
- Pattern reuse: `ChatTodoListWidget` height calculation + layout hooks.

## Error & Edge Handling
- Flush failure: show notification with Retry; keep queue (or rehydrate) based on severity.
- Race protection: per-session in-flight flush promise map.
- Session switch with queued messages: auto-flush or warn & discard (decision left for validation; initial approach = auto-flush to reduce surprise).
- Agent mode unavailability mid-queue: still flush as generic chat input (no agent-only assumption).

## Testing Strategy
Unit (`chatQueueService.test.ts`): queue limits, truncation, event emission, flush ordering.
Integration (`chatWidget.integrationTest.ts`): queuing during active request, flush on completion, attachments from latest only.
Performance (`chatQueueService.perf.test.ts`): rapid enqueue (100 ops), time < target threshold, memory bounds.
Accessibility: ARIA label & announcement hooks (where test infra permits); manual verification fallback.
Failure scenarios: simulated send failure â†’ retry path.

## Risks & Mitigations
| Risk | Mitigation |
|------|-----------|
| Memory growth via long texts | Strict per-message & total limits, truncation |
| User confusion (hidden queue) | Status bar indicator + tooltip + announcements |
| Race (double flush) | Single in-flight flush promise guard |
| Mode / session churn | Flush or clear on session disposal; universal queuing logic |
| Attachment mismatch | Only latest retained; log if earlier had attachments dropped |
| Performance regression | Debounce events; small fixed queue; perf test gate |
| Localization omissions | All new strings through `nls`, placeholder usage |

## File Structure (Planned Additions / Mods)
```
src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/
  common/
    chatQueueService.ts
    chatQueueServiceImpl.ts
  browser/
    chatQueueStatus.ts
    chatWidget.ts (modified)
    chat.contribution.ts (registration + status instantiation)
  test/
    common/chatQueueService.test.ts
    common/chatQueueService.perf.test.ts
    browser/chatWidget.integrationTest.ts
```

## Implementation Phases
Phase 1: Service + status bar + basic flush + tests.
Phase 2: Telemetry + accessibility refinements + error UX.
Phase 3: Optional sticky widget (only if justified).
Phase 4: Enhancements (preview command, cancellation, metrics adjustments).

## Architectural Decision Records
- ADR-1: Service vs local state â†’ Service chosen for reuse & testability.
- ADR-2: Universal queuing (simpler, consistent UX) vs mode-limited.
- ADR-3: Status bar first (minimal footprint) before introducing new layout surface.
- ADR-4: Hard limits protect perf & memory at small complexity cost.

## Success Criteria
- Queue preserves user input reliably; zero data loss in tested cases.
- No regressions in existing chat flows (baseline run). 
- Flush latency negligible relative to standard request cycle.
- Accessibility announcements verified; localized strings added.
- Users can discover queued state without intrusive UI.

## Out of Scope (Future Consideration)
- Per-item editing / deletion controls.
- Per-item attachment merging.
- Cross-session queue transfer.
- Persistence of queue across reload.

---
Feedback welcome on: scope boundaries, flush timing, attachment policy, and whether auto-flushing on session switch is preferable to warning + discard.

title: File icon display handling in chat sessions
author: vijayupadya
body:
Fixes #265150

Chat session icons use `ThemeIcon` objects (like `Codicon.loading`, `Codicon.pass`, etc.) which get the `predefined-file-icon` CSS class. When file icons are globally disabled, a CSS rule in style.css hides all elements with this class, affecting chat session icons unintentionally. 
This change implements overrides in chatSessions.

title: Use custom icon for chatSessions to continue showing when FileIcon is turned off
author: vijayupadya
body:
Fixes #265150

Chat Sessions is using VS Code's standard ResourceLabel component which respects global file icon theme settings. When file icons setting is turned off, global CSS rule .predefined-file-icon { display: none !important; } hides all icons rendered through this system.
This change implements a custom icon for Chat Sessions similar to Timeline and Outline views that bypasses the file icon theme.

title: Feature/107183 add ability to right align tree items description
author: trapgar
body:
Issue #107183: Add a new right-aligned "description" property to TreeItems

Added the ability for VS Code extensions utilizing the [`TreeView`](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/extension-guides/tree-view) to horizontally align the `description` property of `TreeItems` to the right. Default value remains left-aligned.

## How to Test
1. Clone the [vscode-extension-samples](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples) project
2. Open the [`tree-view-sample`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/main/tree-view-sample) in Code
3. Open [`src/nodeDependencies.ts#`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/blob/main/tree-view-sample/src/nodeDependencies.ts#L98)
4. Add a new line right below where the `TreeItem.description` is being set
    > this.alignment = 'right';`

    *(since the repo references a released version of the vscode api you will want to also add an `// @ts-ignore` right about it just for testing)*
5. Run the extension as usual
6. Open any repo utilizing npm (I just created a new folder and ran `> npm i three`
7. Click on the new list clover in the left-hand sidebar that the extension added
8. Expand the tree and all the package versions will now be aligned to the right

Since `TreeItem` actions appear to the right, the description will hide any-time they show as to not clash.

title: chatSessions API redesign/experiment
author: joshspicer
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

Experiment for https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268063
Demo extension implementation: https://github.com/joshspicer/joshbot/

GHPR: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github/pull/7849
Claude: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/pull/1147

- Do not dynamically register chat participant (let extension do that)
- Introduce concept of 'untitled' chat session
  - First request is not lost (leans more on existing chat participant API)
- `onDidCommitChatSessionItem` to swap untitled sessions -> backed sessions


This change is NOT backward-compatible since we will not longer register the chat participant implementation dynamically. The implementing extension should now register the participant.

This lets us delete `provideNewChatSessionItem` and remove `requestHandler` per chat session (instead using the chat participant as the handler). Those could be removed later but will not be done here.

title: fix(snap): detect Wayland socket under XDG_RUNTIME_DIR for Fedora
body:
The proposed change fixes a Wayland detection issue in the VS Code snap launcher on Fedora and similar distributions. Currently, the script only checks for the Wayland socket in the parent runtime directory ($XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/../$WAYLAND_DISPLAY), which causes Wayland to be incorrectly marked unavailable when the socket is actually in $XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/$WAYLAND_DISPLAY. This patch updates the script to check both locations and enable Wayland if either exists, creating a symlink only when needed. The change ensures correct Wayland detection, maintains backward compatibility, avoids breaking existing setups, and allows VS Code and other applications to properly use Wayland instead of falling back to X11, with minimal and safe modifications to the launcher script.

title: Implement welcome view rendering scheduler to prevent reentrant calls
author: bhavyaus
body:
Take 2 at fixing: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267105

Previous attempt https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/267856 was [reverted](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/268002) because first chat request in an empty window was not being rendered. This was because the chat list visibility was controlled by the welcomeView rendering logic. When the welcome view rendering was scheduled from within in `onDidChangeItems`, the chat list view visibility was not updated before the chat tree was progressively rendered which caused the first request to be missed.

In this pr, additional to the logic in #267856, I also moved out the logic to toggle visibility of the welcome/chatList view out of the welcome rendering logic here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/268023/files#diff-1a26fc97bbf0d39b6d25ad9fe509fad4d90373118985b50709f99b6ef5bde8c9R935

And update it here inside `onDidChangeItems` : https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/268023/files#diff-1a26fc97bbf0d39b6d25ad9fe509fad4d90373118985b50709f99b6ef5bde8c9R884

cc: @justschen

title: edits: allow keep/undo during an agent response
author: connor4312
body:
Only disable keep/undo for an editor if it's currently streaming in
edits. Allow global keep all/undo all during an agent response, but just
exclude any entries currently streaming in edits when that happens.

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/255464

title: Chat - switch chat toolbar to use overlay widget
author: lszomoru
body: This pull request switches the chat session toolbar to use an overlay widget so that we can take advantage of stacking overlay widgets in the lower right hand corner in order to address the edge case in which both the chat session toolbar is being shown as well as the "editor content button" (ex: Resolve in Merge Editor). PR also contains a drive-by fix for stacking overlay widgets in the top/bottom right corners.

title: Copy selection for deleted chunk in inline diff
author: Mingpan
body:
An attempt to fix #8226 

Hi @hediet , can I interest you with (yet another) PR for #8226, a.k.a. inline diff deleted chunk copy selection? :)

The main idea is to calculate the exact line and column for the start & end of the selection in a view zone, and extract the corresponding code chunk using the text model API.

Demo: 
![copySelectionInlineDelete](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b64cec2-aed4-4e39-9b5f-854cf3f06c83)

This works with both the menu item, and the browser 'copy' event (Ctrl/Cmd+C).

I have put the setup in a reusable method in a separate file, following the example of [renderLines.ts](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/editor/browser/widget/diffEditor/components/diffEditorViewZones/renderLines.ts)

Due to the view zone, there are some hackery involved to get those line and column numbers right (the line number extraction is the same as that from the [inlineDiffDeletedCodeMargin.ts](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/editor/browser/widget/diffEditor/components/diffEditorViewZones/inlineDiffDeletedCodeMargin.ts)). Let me know if you see any issues, or if you prefer to solve it in a different way.

Thanks!

title: add header to chat list items
author: meganrogge
body:
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/261862

An issue with this still is when I use VoiceOver's quick nav (enable with `UpArrow` and `DownArrow` simultaneously), then `H` or `Shift H` to go between headers is that the chat list does not scroll to reveal new headers. 

I have commented on https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267152 to ask why header navigation is preferrable to our `upArrow/downArrow` list navigation mechanism that does scroll properly.

title: fix: adds aria-description to provide screen reader context for tooltip
author: essjay05
body:
Updates Command Command Center control workspace button to have an aria- description to provide screen reader context for the tooltip that appears when Search Workspace is hovered.

Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267817

## Steps to Test:

1. Checkout the PR: git checkout
2. Rebuild and Run the project. Follow the standard process for building the project and launching the IDE.
3. Enable a screen reader: Turn on a screen reader on your operating system (e.g., VoiceOver on macOS, NVDA on Windows, or ChromeVox on ChromeOS).
4. Hover or focus on the "Search Workspace" button in the `.monaco-action-bar`/VSCode toolbar at the top.
5. Observe the screen reader announcing the button text value as well as the text value of the tooltip that appears on focus/hover.

title: reduce memory by ~1.2 MB
author: SimonSiefke
body: ### Overview This changes the `toDisposable` function to use a class so that there is one dispose function on the class prototype instead of a dispose closure created for each `toDisposable` function call. The memory savings seem to be ~1.2 MB. ### Function overview chart This function overview chart of vscode shows how many function instances exist of each function: ![base](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/60588385-ad2c-4f9f-be21-f9024e3100cc) Notably at the top is `createSingleCallFunction`, which is used by `toDisposable`. ### Heapsnapshot before ### Heapsnapshot after ### Notable differences: - The number of `Functions` is reduced from 117165 to 96305 - The number of `closures (System Context)` is reduced from 55728 to 35040 - The number of `{ dispose }` objects is reduced from 11342 to 1192 - The number of `FunctionDisposables` increases from 0 to 10087 - The memory savings seem to be ~1.2 MB.

title: Fix: Disable window shadows on macOS Tahoe to prevent GPU performance issues
author: avarayr
body:
## Summary

Fixes #267022
Fixes #267065

related: https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311

macOS Darwin 26 (Tahoe) has a WindowServer bug that causes (some?) windows with shadows to consume 80%+ GPU resources. This change disables VSCode window shadows specifically for Darwin 25.x to work around the performance regression.

## Changes

- Added version check in `defaultBrowserWindowOptions` to detect Darwin 25.x
- Set `options.hasShadow = false` only on affected macOS versions
- Applied fix centrally to ensure all VSCode windows are affected consistently

## Testing

- Tested on macOS Tahoe - GPU usage drops significantly - from constant 80% to normal 15%

## Notes

This is a temporary workaround until Apple fixes the underlying WindowServer bug in macOS Tahoe. The version check can be refined or removed once the OS-level issue is resolved.

title: feat(scm): detect worktree hierarchy from inside and outside primary worktree closes #259083 #267612 #259083
author: eddienubes
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
## Prerequisites
This PR improves recently introduced git worktree support.
1. Worktree detection improvements.
Worktree hierarchy in the `repository` tab of the SCM view is shown only when the **primary worktree** is open  as described in #259083 and upstream issues.
2. `${activeRepositoryName}` `window.title` variable
Currently, it simply shows the folder name of the _open worktree_.
By showing the `primary` worktree folder name instead, we'll support other variations to customize window.title.
If someone wants to stick to open worktree folder name, they can simply use `${folderName}` variable.
The detailed use-case is described in #251596.

The reason I combined these changes in a single PR is that primary repository name derivation is tightly coupled with the way SCM detects worktrees.

## Setup
```bash
mkdir test-folder && cd test-folder
git init repo && cd repo
touch test.txt && git add . && git commit -m "init" # introduce first commit
git worktree add test-worktree-inside
git worktree add ../test-worktree-outside
```
### Scenario 1: Opening the primary worktree 
It shouldn't be any different. Hierarchy is shown within the SCM view + worktrees are detected.
### Scenario 2: Opening the `test-worktree-inside` worktree
Should have the same output as Scenario 1.
### Scenario 3: Opening the `test-worktree-outside`
Should have the same output as Scenario 1.

## Notes
I could decouple the changes and submit another PR if required.
Also, I don't see any unit tests for the SCM `model.ts`. Let me know if I should add test coverage.
Although this PR improves worktree detection, it still doesn't support hierarchy using worktrees with bare repositories as reported in #267606

title: Fix NODE_OPTIONS environment variable inheritance on Windows
author: Prhmma
body:
## Summary
Fixes NODE_OPTIONS environment variable inheritance in VS Code integrated terminal on Windows. Currently, NODE_OPTIONS settings like `--max-old-space-size` are ignored when running Node.js processes from VS Code's integrated terminal on Windows, while they work correctly in regular cmd/PowerShell terminals.

## Associated Issue
Fixes #231076

## Root Cause
The issue has two parts:
1. **Platform Inconsistency**: The NODE_OPTIONS restoration logic was limited to macOS only (`if (isMacintosh)` condition)
2. **Missing Windows Support**: The Windows launcher script (`code.cmd`) didn't preserve NODE_OPTIONS like the macOS launcher does

## Changes Made

### 1. Updated Windows Launcher Script (`resources/win32/bin/code.cmd`)
- Added preservation of `NODE_OPTIONS` and `NODE_REPL_EXTERNAL_MODULE` environment variables
- Follows the same pattern as the macOS launcher script
- Variables are saved as `VSCODE_NODE_OPTIONS` and `VSCODE_NODE_REPL_EXTERNAL_MODULE` before being cleared

### 2. Extended Terminal Environment Restoration (`src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/common/terminalEnvironment.ts`)
- Removed macOS-only condition for NODE_OPTIONS restoration
- Made the restoration logic work on all platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing macOS behaviour

## How to Test

### Prerequisites
1. Set NODE_OPTIONS environment variable:
   ```powershell
   # In PowerShell (as Administrator for system-wide)
   [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("NODE_OPTIONS", "--max-old-space-size=16384", "User")

title: test(base): add unit tests for Event.fromObservable and fromObservablâ€¦
author: SaaiAravindhRaja
body:
This pull request adds a new test suite for the `Event.fromObservable` and `Event.fromObservableLight` methods, ensuring their correct behavior when converting observables to events. The tests cover initial value emission, subsequent updates, disposal behavior, batch updates, and handling of undefined initial values.

**New tests for observable-to-event conversion:**

* Added `eventObservable.test.ts` with tests verifying that `Event.fromObservable` emits the initial value, subsequent changes, and stops after disposal, and that `Event.fromObservableLight` signals only on changes without payload.
* Included tests to ensure batch updates are coalesced into a single notification and that undefined initial values are handled correctly.

title: fix: updates quickInputBox aria role to combobox
author: essjay05
body:
Changes quickInputBox aria role from textbox to combobox. Combobox is more appropriate since it follows the a11y pattern of having a popup and controls a list. Attempts to improve communication with the screen reader by providing a more appropriate aria role.

Fixes: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267445

## Steps to Test:
1. Checkout the PR: git checkout <branch-name>

2. Rebuild and Run the Project: Follow the standard process for building the project and launching the IDE.

3. Enable a screen reader: Turn on a screen reader on your operating system (e.g., VoiceOver on macOS, NVDA on Windows, or ChromeVox on ChromeOS).

4. Open the Quick Input Dialog: Use the keyboard shortcut to open the "Search Workspaces" or "Open File" dialog (e.g., Cmd+Shift+P or Cmd+P).

5. Verify the ARIA Role: Focus the search input field and listen to the screen reader's announcement. It should now announce the input as a "combobox" or something similar, confirming that the ARIA role has been correctly updated.

6. Test Functionality: Ensure that the core functionality of the input still works as expected. Verify that you can still type to filter the list of suggestions, use the arrow keys to navigate the list, and press Enter to select an item.

title: welcome - fix bad `matches` implementation
author: bpasero
body:
Having `matches` be dependent on a `selectedCategory` property is very risky because it is possible that initially multiple inputs are not considered equal but then later are.

@bhavyaus fyi, I saw a bug where 2 welcome editors were opened, both active in the editor group. I am not sure if this is a recent regression but `matches` cannot be depending on a property such as `selectedCategory` that only gets set later because then there is a chance that you can open multiple getting started inputs that later all select the same category and then are all considered equal. The editor group relies on a deterministic `matches` implementation that does not change later.

title: Add notification positioning setting
author: cyenite
body: ## Summary Adds a new `workbench.notifications.position` setting that allows users to position notification toasts in any bottom corner of the workbench (bottom-right, bottom-left). This stems from an issue I face constantly, where notifications on the bottom right would often overlap my copilot chat window. ## Changes - **Configuration**: Added `workbench.notifications.position` setting with enum validation - **Constants**: Added `NotificationPosition` enum and `NOTIFICATIONS_POSITION_SETTING` constant - **Logic**: Enhanced `NotificationsToasts` and `NotificationsCenter` to apply position classes based on configuration - **Styling**: Added CSS for both bottom corner positions with proper animations and width constraints - **Accessibility**: Maintained existing behavior and animations, added smooth transitions for all positions ## Implementation Details - Default behavior unchanged (bottom-right positioning) - Proper flex alignment for left vs right positioned notifications - Configuration changes applied immediately without restart ## Testing 1. Change `workbench.notifications.position` setting in user settings 2. Trigger notifications (info, warning, error) 3. Verify notifications appear in correct corner 4. Test all positions: `bottomRight`, `bottomLeft` 5. Verify animations work correctly for each position ## Screenshots

title: Fix and update the definition of fullwidth characters
author: radobot
body:
This fixes and updates the list of wide and fullwidth Unicode characters. Previously, some wide characters were not included and some were incorrectly classified as fullwidth when they aren't.

To determine which characters to include, the Unicode East Asian Width property is used. Since this property is not commonly available in runtimes a hardcoded list is used instead.

title: dispose of ref instead of object itself to avoid null objects.
author: dmiska25
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

This PR fixes an issue with scrolling in Copilot chats with many code blocks (100+). The behavior is that after scrolling up and down through the chat, some code blocks shrink to 0 height and the code is no longer visible. See the included video for an example:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/98af5b0a-6951-4bc3-b2dd-0f68c9fad906

---

### Root Cause
The problem came from how `CodeBlockModelCollection` was disposing models. It was calling `ref.object.dispose()`, which disposes the **underlying text model itself**. Instead, it should call `ref.dispose()`, which disposes the **reference** and releases it.  

By disposing the model directly, later code block components ended up with null/invalid models during virtualization cycles. Thatâ€™s why editors collapsed or reported `content height = -1`.

---

### Fix
Replace calls to `ref.object.dispose()` with `ref.dispose()` in `delete()` and `clear()`. This properly disposes the reference, allowing models to remain valid and be reused when scrolling back.

---

### Testing
- Manually tested with an OSS build of VS Code and Copilot Chat, reproducing the bug with >100 code blocks. After the fix, blocks remain visible when scrolling.  
- Ran automated tests (`./scripts/test.sh`) with no regressions.  
- See fix example here:  

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4425097-919a-4212-8d63-4890af7a6c57  

---

### Related
Fixes #266296  
Related telemetry issues: #240028, #248829, #255827

title: feat: add resource-scoped prompt file recommendations
author: digitarald
body:
This PR enhances the `chat.promptFilesRecommendations` setting to support workspace folder-level configuration with proper inheritance hierarchy.

## Changes

- **Configuration scope**: Added `ConfigurationScope.RESOURCE` to enable folder-level settings
- **Context-aware recommendations**: Prompt suggestions now consider the active editor's workspace folder
- **Configuration merging**: Implemented proper inheritance (default â†’ user â†’ workspace â†’ folder)

## Key Benefits

- Different projects can have tailored prompt recommendations
- Workspace folder settings override workspace/user settings appropriately  
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing global configurations
- Enables resource-aware when clauses (e.g., `resourceExtname == .js`) to work correctly

## Implementation

Follows established VS Code patterns:
- Uses `EditorResourceAccessor.getOriginalUri()` for resource context (consistent with 20+ other features)
- Leverages `configService.inspect()` with resource parameter for proper configuration inheritance
- Maintains type safety and robust error handling

The changes make the existing documentation for resource-aware when clauses fully functional.

title: Linux desktop file: Add inode/directory support
author: ferdnyc
body:
Adding `inode/directory` to the list of supported `MimeType`s allows VSCode to be shown (with priority placement) in the application list shown when a user right-clicks in (or on) a folder and chooses "Open With..."

At least in GNOME Nautilus, VSCode can be selected anyway (all applications are listed), but it's at the bottom of a potentially very long list. Adding the `MimeType` to the `code.desktop` file moves it up to the much shorter "Recommended Apps" list at the top.

title: Just remove the Tab handler
author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
So, all this is trying to do is to see if the TAB/SHIFT+TAB will leave the quick pick (which will then dismiss the quick pick in some cases)  by finding the first and last tabbable element and if that's the active element, then wrap around.

I really think that removing this is not going to affect any folks that much and so I want to try removing it. In doing so this fixes a couple of long standing issues.

Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258430
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/98479

title: Fix dialog cancel button placement
author: ensorrow
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
This pull request addresses issue #265989 by updating the placement of the cancel button in the dialog component.
Previously, the cancel button was inserted at a fixed position using buttonMap.splice(1, 0, cancelButton);, which could lead to inconsistencies in button order, especially when dialogs have custom button configurations.

**Change summary**:

Replaces buttonMap.splice(1, 0, cancelButton); with buttonMap.push(cancelButton); in src/vs/base/browser/ui/dialog/dialog.ts
Ensures the cancel button is always placed at the end of the button list for consistent UI behavior
Impact:

Dialog cancel button will appear in a more predictable and user-friendly position
Aligns with standard dialog button placement practices
Closes #265989.

title: fix: race condition on supported task types
author: CGNonofr
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

fix #265845

In https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/212163, the `registerSupportedExecutions` was changed so that in web mode, the function doesn't wait for all default task extensions registration before running the task, because in web mode, only the `custom` mode is supported.

However, when there is a remote server, the server will register the support for all task execution types, but later.

A race condition can happen, in which the tasks are parsed before the server reports the supported task executions, leading to a `Warning: shell tasks are unavailable in the current environment.` error.

This PR makes the `registerSupportedExecutions` method wait for all task supported executions in web mode when there is a remote agent.

title: feat: Add session ID to telemetry events for completions provider
author: ankitshah009
body:
- Add sessionId parameter to inlineCompletionAccept and inlineCompletionPartialAccept in EditSources
- Include session ID in inline completion telemetry events
- Add new chatCompletionAccepted telemetry event for completions from chat
- Enhance InlineEditArcTelemetrySender to include session ID in telemetry

Addresses issues #265831 and #265829

This change improves telemetry tracking by including session IDs in completion events, enabling better analysis of user behavior across sessions.

title: provide progress messages to screen reader users, enable opting out
author: meganrogge
body:
fix #265403

Visually, we indicate tool progress with messages. Before, screen reader users would only hear "Working" and the chat progress sound. 

Now, they'll hear the tool progress messages such as: `searched for x in ..test.ts, no results` so that they know if it's on the right track. Since this can be verbose, I've added an opt-out setting and included this in the accessibility help dialog.

### Now

title: fix: elicitation email validator
author: garciasdos
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
This pull request fixes a bug in the email validation logic within the `McpElicitationService`. The previous implementation incorrectly marked emails containing an '@' as invalid; this change corrects the logic to properly validate email addresses.

- Bug fix: Corrected the email validation in the `_validateStringFormat` method of `McpElicitationService` to ensure that values containing an '@' are now considered valid emails.

fixes #265325

title: fix: memory leak in InlayHints
author: SimonSiefke
body:
### Before

Scrolling up and down in an editor 197 times:

![shapes at 25-09-04 12 48 22](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b004a33-e1cd-43ae-a6c7-0eeaf76875b9)


It seems that when scrolling the the inlay hints are queried and added to `sessionDisposables` making `sessionDisposables` grow by one each time.


### Change

The change uses a separate `disposableStore` so that each time the `RunOnceScheduler` runs, the previous `disposableStore` removed and disposed. 


In order to not manage the `cancelToken`, `disposableStore` and `mutableDisposable` individually, a new class `CancellationStore` has been added that combines them.

title: Fixes "Caret jumps to column 0 when clicking between first two characters"
author: ttttotem
body:
Fixes issue https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263098 that was introduced in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/235174

Problem:
xLeftBoundary is not correctly at where the left most line of the editor content, it is blocking clicking on the first column

Solution:
Remove horizontalScrollPadding from the cursor leaving editor content on the left side check. horizontalScrollPadding should not have been added to the left side check because layoutInfo.contentLeft correctly matches the left most point of the editor content

author: SoCuul
body:
Adds syntax highlighting for the remaining opaque Objective-C types/structs: [Method](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/objectivec/method?language=objc), [Ivar](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/objectivec/ivar?language=objc), and [Protocol](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/objectivec/protocol?language=objc).

These are in addition to the currently highlighted type: [Class](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/objectivec/class?language=objc).

title: fix: memory leak in QuickDiffModel
author: SimonSiefke
body:
Before (Typing in editor 197 times): ![Untitled](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73051090-cb01-4553-a368-3570fa4fe188) When typing into the editor 197 times, it seems that the number of QuickDiffModel functions increases by one each time.
The json lists `src/vs/workbench/contrib/scm/browser/quickDiffModel.ts:232:10` as source: ```ts this._diffDelayer .trigger(async () => { const result: { allChanges: QuickDiffChange[]; changes: QuickDiffChange[]; mapChanges: Map } | null = await this.diff(); const editorModels = Array.from(this._originalEditorModels.values()); if (!result || this._disposed || this._model.isDisposed() || editorModels.some(editorModel => editorModel.isDisposed())) { return; // disposed } this.setChanges(result.allChanges, result.changes, result.mapChanges); }) .catch(err => onUnexpectedError(err)); // here ```
After registering the `_diffDelayer` disposable, the issue seems to be resolved.
JSON Data Details ```jsonc { "namedFunctionCount3": [ { "count": 203, "delta": 203, "name": "anonymous", "sourceLocation": "vscode-file://vscode-app/workspace/vscode-memory-leak-finder/.vscode-test/vscode-linux-x64-1.103.2/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:569:18762", "originalLocation": "src/vs/workbench/contrib/comments/browser/commentsController.ts:710:11", "originalName": "CommentController.beginComputeCommentingRanges" }, { "count": 203, "delta": 203, "name": "anonymous", "sourceLocation": "vscode-file://vscode-app/workspace/vscode-memory-leak-finder/.vscode-test/vscode-linux-x64-1.103.2/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:569:18902", "originalLocation": "src/vs/workbench/contrib/comments/browser/commentsController.ts:715:7", "originalName": "CommentController.beginComputeCommentingRanges" }, { "count": 203, "delta": 203, "name": "anonymous", "sourceLocation": "vscode-file://vscode-app/workspace/vscode-memory-leak-finder/.vscode-test/vscode-linux-x64-1.103.2/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:430:48674", "originalLocation": "src/vs/editor/contrib/folding/browser/folding.ts:344:23", "originalName": "unknown" }, { "count": 203, "delta": 203, "name": "anonymous", "sourceLocation": "vscode-file://vscode-app/workspace/vscode-memory-leak-finder/.vscode-test/vscode-linux-x64-1.103.2/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:527:23529", "originalLocation": "src/vs/workbench/contrib/scm/browser/quickDiffModel.ts:232:10", "originalName": "QuickDiffModel" } ], "isLeak": true } ```

title: fix: memory leak in chat widget
author: SimonSiefke
body:
Before (Opening and Closing Chat Widget 197 times): 

![Untitled](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed714cce-093f-401e-8902-d828135cce9d)

It seems that each time opening the chat widget, a new timeout disposable is registered, which seems to make the number of disposables grow by one each time.


The change uses a MutableDisposable to clear the previous timeout disposable when the setVisible function is called.

title: Disable macOS broker support due to blocking MSAL bug
author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
Sigh... Unfortunately, MSAL seems to fail for clients that don't have managed machines that have opted in to the broker... I have opened a blocking issue on them internally.

At least, when they fix it, it would just be a matter of updating the package version and the conditional here.

title: fix: memory leak in ReplAccessibilityAnnouncer
author: SimonSiefke
body:
Before (Running Debug 197 times):
![Untitled](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07d8f281-fa1b-432a-832f-30e1aadcf030)


This changes the disposable to be a mutableDisposable. Since there seems to be only one global `ReplAccessibilityAnnouncer`, registering another disposable onto it when the debug session focus changes seems to make the number of disposables grow by one each time.

title: tools: re-apply confirm response based on promise
author: connor4312
body:
> Note: for merging after endgame

This re-applies #263894 and fixes #264023 by removing a surprising
behavior in the DeferredPromise where calling complete() with additional
values will update the settled `deferred.value` without affecting the
original promise (which can of course only resolve once.)

title: feat(ts-codeLens): show "implementations" CodeLens for overridden methods #263749
author: ritesh006
body:
Summary
This PR adds support for showing "implementations" CodeLens on TypeScript methods that are overridden in derived classes.

Changes
Extended TypeScriptImplementationsCodeLensProvider to surface implementations for:
Class methods (not just interfaces or abstract methods)
Overridden methods in derived classes
Updated extractSymbol logic to correctly identify these symbols
Added smoke test: implementationsCodeLens.test.ts to validate behavior
Why
Resolves https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/198387.

Developers can now see "1 implementation" / "n implementations" CodeLens above methods that are overridden, and navigate directly to their derived class implementations.
This aligns CodeLens behavior with the â€œFind All Implementationsâ€ command.

Verification
Open an abstract/base class with a method that is overridden in derived classes.
Confirm that the "implementations" CodeLens appears above the method.
Clicking it navigates to the derived class overrides.
Testing
Local build & compile successful
Hygiene checks passed
Smoke test added & executed
Integration tests run successfully (scripts/test-integration.bat)
Notes
This improvement makes CodeLens more consistent and increases productivity when working with object-oriented TypeScript codebases.

Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/198387

title: Adjust dropdown positioning in settings editor to prevent distance from controls
author: codekalinga
body:
Fixes #264357

## Problem
Dropdown menus in the settings editor were opening too far away from their trigger controls, causing visual disconnect and poor UX.

## Solution
Added a 10px offset specifically for dropdown positioning in the settings editor by detecting the `.settings-editor` class context.

## Changes
- Modified `getDomNodePagePosition()` in `src/vs/base/browser/dom.ts`
- Added settings page detection using `closest('.settings-editor')` 
- Applied 10px vertical offset only for settings editor dropdowns

## Testing
Verified dropdowns now open with proper proximity to controls in settings editor while maintaining normal behavior elsewhere.

title: win32(installer): Normalize PATH handling and fix uninstall filtering [needs testing]
author: yugook
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

âš ï¸ This PR updates PATH handling logic in the Windows installer.
Changes are verified with string-based tests (PowerShell), but I would appreciate further testing on real Windows setups.


## Summary
Normalize PATH handling in the Windows installer (`build/win32/code.iss`) and fix uninstall filtering:
- Trim trailing separators when comparing (`\` and `/`)
- Case-insensitive comparison
- Consider 8.3 short names (when available)
- Handle empty / semicolon-terminated PATH without producing malformed values

## Why
- Avoid duplicate PATH entries when the existing entry has a trailing slash or is in 8.3 short form.
- Ensure uninstall removes VS Codeâ€™s PATH entry (both long and short forms).

## How
- Add `TrimTrailingSlash` helper.
- `NeedsAddToPath`: explode PATH, normalize each segment, compare against long and short names.
- `AddToPath`: treat empty/absent PATH specially; respect trailing `;`.
- Uninstall: normalize `{app}\bin`, compare against both long/short, rebuild PATH cleanly.

## Before / After (examples)
- **Before**: PATH contains `â€¦;C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\bin\` â†’ installer adds `â€¦;C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\bin` (duplicate).
- **After**: no duplicate added.
- **Before**: PATH contains `â€¦;C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~1\bin` â†’ uninstall sometimes leaves it behind.
- **After**: long/short both removed.

## Verification
- Windows Sandbox, PowerShell dry-run (strings only; no system writes):
  - trailing slash present â†’ `NeedsAddToPath: False`; `RemoveFromPath`: entry removed
  - 8.3 short present â†’ `NeedsAddToPath: False`; `RemoveFromPath`: entry removed
  - empty PATH â†’ `AddToPath`: `C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\bin`
  - PATH ends with `;` â†’ no malformed value produced
(Full installer tests can be run if preferred.)

## Risk / Impact
Low: changes are isolated to installer script and guarded when 8.3 names are not available.

title: Git: Remove problematic ruler at 50 chars
author: walles
body:
The ruler at column 50, introduced in #201091, is wrong for all lines except for the first. Also, having it there breaks interaction with the (quite popular) rewrap extension:

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=stkb.rewrap

The best solution would be if we could have different rulers for different lines, (50 for line 1, 0 for line 2 and 72 for the rest), but since that's not possible (or is it?), I believe dropping 50 is the best way forward.

Regarding the user experience, overflowing chars are highlighted anyway since #173195, so users who write too long subject lines will still be informed, even without that ruler in place.

Since I use rewrap all the time, and I commit things all the time, the current behavior is problematic for me.

"rewrap" uses the rulers to decide where to wrap text.

Before #201091, it wrapped at 72 chars, which was great!

With #201091 in place, it now wraps all lines at 50 chars, which is bad.

title: fix toolConfirmation icon and completion status
author: rwoll
body:
* `getIcon` did not account for `ToolConfirmKind.Setting` (e.g. auto-approve)
* `completion` promise was being changed to `Canceled` despite it already being resolved.

See my [verbose(!) debugging comment](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/264023#issuecomment-3237889813)
which walks you through states of `ConfirmationKind`
in `getIcon` under different commits.

Fixes #264023.
Relates #263314 (`getIcon` added by @connor4312).
Relates #262982 (`ConfirmationKind.UserSetting` added by @Tyriar).
Supercedes #264047 (revert of a commit that changed confirmation logic from sync -> async by @rwoll).

Reviewers: I'm not 100% on what the expected UI iconography experience is, so
please verify that the icons align with what y'all have in mind.

Suggested follow ups:

- Tests - especially one around `getIcon` to ensure it handles `ConfirmationKind`
      exhaustively as folks add new kinds.

title: Add URL handler for chat message
author: ntrogh
body:
This URL handler allows external applications to insert messages into the VS Code chat interface via URLs. The chat message is inserted in the chat input field but is _not_ submitted. The user is prompted if they want to insert the specific prompt in chat.

## URL Format

```
code-oss:chat-message?prompt=<encoded-prompt-text>&mode=<chat-mode>
```

### Parameters

- `prompt` (required): The text to insert into the chat input field (URL encoded)
- `mode` (optional): The chat mode to set. Defaults to 'agent'. Supports both built-in modes ('ask', 'edit', 'agent') and custom chat modes defined in `.chatmode` files

## Examples

```
code-oss:chat-message?prompt=Hello%20World
```

```
code-oss:chat-message?prompt=Explain%20this%20code&mode=ask
```

```
code-oss:chat-message?prompt=Review%20my%20JavaScript%20code%20for%20potential%20bugs%20and%20security%20issues&mode=agent
```

## Test steps

1. Run **Developer: Open URL** command in Command Palette
1. Enter a URL like:
   - `code-oss:chat-message?prompt=Test%20prompt`
   - `code-oss:chat-message?prompt=Hello&mode=ask`

The handler should:
1. Show a confirmation dialog with the prompt preview
2. Upon confirmation, open the chat view
3. Set the specified chat mode
4. Insert the prompt text into the input field but not submit it
5. Focus the input field for user interaction

title: fix: ensure SVG images are loaded before clipboard copy
author: lukocode
body:
Fixes intermittent clipboard copy failures for SVG output where users
encountered "No blob data to write to clipboard" errors. The issue was
caused by a race condition where canvas operations proceeded before
the dynamically created Image element finished loading the SVG data URL.
- Add ensureImageLoaded helper to wait for image load completion
- Handle both already-loaded and loading states
- Include error handling and 5-second timeout protection
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing image copy functionality

Fixes: #265020

title: Maintain line breaks in transform to Camel and Pascal case actions
author: alpalla
body:
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/261387.

# Transform to Camel Case

## Single line transformations

I split this in two cases. When a single line (without line breaks) is selected, the behavior remains unchanged. I did this because I noticed unit tests that assert that white space characters should be considered as valid word boundaries.

Example
```
"camel from words" -> "camelFromWords"
``` 

## Multiline transformations

On the other hand, in case of a selection spanning multiple lines I changed the relevant regex to only consider `_` and `-` as valid word boundaries. Effectively guaranteeing correct transformations only when coming from kebab or snake case. 

I did this because considering tabs as word boundaries will break the indentation for a code block. And as @RedCMD suggested, I also think it makes sense to treat `a-b c-d` as separate words (-> `aB cD`).

# Transform to Pascal Case

Here I was much more conservative because this transformation has some extra logic to capitalize the first letter of a word
```ts
return words.map((word: string) => word.substring(0, 1).toLocaleUpperCase() + word.substring(1))
			.join('')
```
Therefore not using spaces and tabs as word boundaries would execute the above logic on spaces and tabs. It was easier to just address the line break problem here and not get lost in edge cases.

# Testing
I added some unit tests, and this should be straightforward to test manually ðŸ™ŒðŸ»

title: feat(ts-codeLens): show "implementations" CodeLens for overridden methods
author: ritesh006
body:
### Summary
This PR adds support for showing **"implementations" CodeLens** on TypeScript methods that are overridden in derived classes.

### Changes
- Extended `TypeScriptImplementationsCodeLensProvider` to surface implementations for:
  - Class methods (not just interfaces or abstract methods)
  - Overridden methods in derived classes
- Updated `extractSymbol` logic to correctly identify these symbols
- Added smoke test: `implementationsCodeLens.test.ts` to validate behavior

### Why
Resolves [#198387](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/198387).

Developers can now see `"1 implementation"` / `"n implementations"` CodeLens above methods that are overridden, and navigate directly to their derived class implementations.  
This aligns CodeLens behavior with the **â€œFind All Implementationsâ€** command.

### Verification
- Open an abstract/base class with a method that is overridden in derived classes.
- Confirm that the `"implementations"` CodeLens appears above the method.
- Clicking it navigates to the derived class overrides.

### Testing
- **Local build & compile successful**
- **Hygiene checks passed**
- **Smoke test added & executed**
- **Integration tests run successfully** (`scripts/test-integration.bat`)

### Notes
This improvement makes CodeLens more consistent and increases productivity when working with object-oriented TypeScript codebases.

---

Fixes #198387

title: fix: move product.overrides resolution to an earlier stage
author: deepak1556
body: product values used within `main.ts` before [startup](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/main.ts#L203), ex: `product.dataFolderName` in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/main.ts#L436  don't get the values from override since resolution of the file happens in `bootstrap-esm`. This came up as a bug, when we tried to read an incorrect argv file in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/vs/code/electron-main/app.ts#L1427

title: add internal filing option to issueReporter
author: Yoyokrazy
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:

  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.

-->

Fixes: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/260182
corresponding addition of the field for copilot chat: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/pull/799

Adds a field into the IssueReporterData that allows the passing of a `privateUri` that represents an internal repository that the user may want to file into for when working on code that may contain sensitive material.

Also contains some structural improvements that organize things a bit and prevent button(s) from getting into broken states. No longer any reliance on context keys or entitlements, just the gh token, and `privateUri` which makes this somewhat extensible

cc/ @justschen

title: fix: parse commands in chat.open commands
author: rwoll
body:
`workbench.action.chat.open` did not always trigger a parse of the input resulting in `/<prompt>` not being recognized as a prompt command when it's expected to.

If `isPartialQuery: false` (default), then the command used [`acceptInput` intead of `setInput`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/709b8fabf55c505cbe5603ce654ecf3a8766a7a6/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/actions/chatActions.ts#L244) only the latter of which will trigger a [re-parse of the query](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/709b8fabf55c505cbe5603ce654ecf3a8766a7a6/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatWidget.ts#L1640) to critcially turn [`/<prompt>` into a `ChatRequestSlashPromptPart`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/d2ff8d16065d4748b8a205bfebdc98d7d76f7864/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatRequestParser.ts#L231).

**Reviewers**: There's a few places `acceptInput` is called with a query in the codebase. It's not clear to me if the others have the same issue or if always triggering a re-parse would double parse.

title: fix (macos): app not closing on cmd+q (only windows close)
author: chrispalmo
body:
## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on macOS.
Press Cmd + Q to quit the app.
2. Observe:
    - All windows close.
    - The app remains in the dock and Cmd + Tab app switcher.
    - Pressing Cmd + Q again results in a screen flash and error sound (if system if configured to alert on os error)
    - Only way to fully quit is via the "Code" menu â†’ "Quit Visual Studio Code".

## Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?:
Yes

## System info

Version: 1.100.1
Commit: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/91fa95bccb027ece6a968589bb1d662fa9c8e170
Date: 2025-05-09T15:43:50.040Z (1 wk ago)
Electron: 34.5.1
ElectronBuildId: 11369351
Chromium: 132.0.6834.210
Node.js: 20.19.0
V8: 13.2.152.41-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 24.4.0

## Previously

This issue was posted here <https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249179> and closed then crash report data was not provided. This isn't a crash, however. Just a UX bug.

title: Add configurable prompt file suggestions with when-clause support
author: digitarald
body: ## Summary This PR introduces a new `promptFilesRecommendations` configuration setting that allows users to configure which prompt files should be suggested in the chat welcome view based on contextual when-clause expressions or simple boolean values. cc @eli-w-king ## Key Features - **Contextual suggestions**: Configure prompt files to appear based on file type, language, or other VS Code context - **Flexible configuration**: Support both boolean values (`true`/`false`) and when-clause expressions - **Smart caching**: Async loading of prompt descriptions to avoid blocking UI rendering - **Unified experience**: Suggestions now work in both experimental and regular welcome views ## Configuration Example ```json { "promptFilesRecommendations": { "plan": true, // Always suggest "a11y-audit": "resourceExtname == .html", // Only for HTML files "document": "resourceLangId == markdown", // Only for Markdown files "debug": false // Never suggest } } ``` ## Implementation Details ### Configuration Schema - Added proper JSON schema with `oneOf` constraints supporting mixed boolean/string types - Comprehensive validation and error handling for when-clause parsing - Experimental tag with clear documentation and examples ### UI Integration - Enhanced `ChatWidget` with intelligent prompt suggestion logic - Added description caching to avoid async calls during rendering - Graceful fallback when descriptions fail to load ### Welcome View Improvements - Moved suggested prompts rendering outside experimental-only blocks - Updated re-render logic to account for prompt suggestion changes - Added helpful onboarding message when no agent-specific welcome exists ## Testing - âœ… Configuration parsing handles various input types correctly - âœ… When-clause evaluation integrates properly with VS Code context system - âœ… Error handling gracefully degrades on invalid configurations - âœ… UI updates correctly when suggestions change ## Related Issues Enhances the reusable prompts feature by making suggestions context-aware and user-configurable. ## Breaking Changes None - this is an additive feature with sensible defaults.

# Fix #-mentions search for files and folder backspace bug

## Reproduction Steps
- have a folder called test with a file called index.md
- user types #t and "test" shows up as a result
- user blackspaces
- user types #t again

expected:
- "test" folder should show

actual:
- nothing shows

---

Additionally, you can see a large variance in search results with you type a part of a filename (e.g "hel" attempting to match a file called "hello.js"). When you first start typing, the results show quite well. Once to backspace, immediately all relevant values drop off.

---
Apologies in advance, I have not tested this and I am hoping to get some help to understand how to do that.

title: Preserve case in multicursor replace command
author: alpalla
body:
# Problem
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/106502.

Reading through the issue it seems the main problem involves preserving the case of the first letter of a variable name when executing a replace command on multiple case-insensitive selections of that word.

# Solution
To fix this, when defining the replace command for a given selection, we can check the case of the first letter of the text to replace, and update the case of the character that will replace it accordingly.

So if we have selections `"value"` and `"Value"`, and type `"a"` (while typing `array`), when composing the replace command for `"Value"` we see that it starts with a capital and replace the selection with `"A"`, not with `"a"`.

For now this logic is only applied in the case of multiple selections.

# Testing
Given
```
const [value, setValue] = useState();
```

Select `"value"` and `"Value"`, and then type `"array"`.

Expected result
```
const [array, setArray] = useState();
```

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a3f2716-1785-45f5-9ff7-ae37d0e482cd

Note: it might make sense to make this feature opt-in, whether through some setting or a dedicated button as was suggested in the issue. I'm open to suggestions. ðŸ™

title: Add more fig specs
author: Tyriar
body:
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263167

This pulls in a lot of specs from upstream. Some of the bigger ones are gh, docker/docker-compose and ruff. This is mostly really safe but there are some parts of this that results in command execution. I reviewed all the specs for troublesome scripts/generators, removing any that look concerning.

To make this more sustainable in the long run it would be so much better if the generators that can execute code were separated from the plain text completions. There aren't that many generators but they are higher risk.

cc @meganrogge

title: Issue #210694 add hoverforeground and hoverbackground to activity bars
author: AminSajedian
body:
This pull request introduces customizable hover colors for the side, top, and bottom activity bars.

The changes address issue #210694 (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/210694), which requested the ability to set hoverForeground and hoverBackground for a more visible hover state on activity bar icons. This implementation allows users to define specific colors in their settings to improve the discoverability and accessibility of the UI.

I've added the necessary color token properties to the activity bar's color contribution points to enable this feature. @benibenj (https://github.com/benibenj)

Testing:
I have verified that the new color settings work as expected and do not introduce any regressions. The hover state now correctly reflects the colors specified in the user's settings.


Modified Files Summary

1. Theme Color Definition [src/vs/workbench/common/theme.ts]
- Define new theme color tokens:
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_HOVER_FOREGROUND`
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_HOVER_BACKGROUND`
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_TOP_HOVER_FOREGROUND`
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_TOP_HOVER_BACKGROUND`

2. Activity Bar: Theming + Wiring [src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/activitybar/activitybarPart.ts]
- Register new hover tokens in theme registry
- Map hover tokens to CSS variables for stylesheet consumption
- Wire hover colors into composite bar configuration

3. Activity Bar CSS (Hover Styles) [src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/activitybar/media/activityaction.css]
- Apply hover styles using new CSS variables:
  - `--vscode-activityBar-hoverForeground`
  - `--vscode-activityBar-hoverBackground`
- Integrate hover states with existing active/focus styling

4. Sidebar: Theming Integration [src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/sidebar/sidebarPart.ts]
- Reference top-position hover tokens for consistency:
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_TOP_HOVER_FOREGROUND`
  - `ACTIVITY_BAR_TOP_HOVER_BACKGROUND`
- Ensure sidebar hover behavior aligns with activity bar when positioned at top or bottom

5. Sidebar CSS (Hover Styles) [src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/sidebar/media/sidebarpart.css]
- Apply hover styling using activity bar CSS variables
- Maintain visual consistency between sidebar and activity bar hover states

6. Stylelint Allowlist [build/lib/stylelint/vscode-known-variables.json]
- Add CSS custom properties to prevent lint errors:
  - `--vscode-activityBar-hoverForeground`
  - `--vscode-activityBar-hoverBackground`

Usage
user's settings:

settings.json
```
{
  "workbench.activityBar.location": "default", // "top" or "bottom"
  "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
    // Left Activity Bar 
    "activityBar.hoverForeground": "#ff0000", 
    "activityBar.hoverBackground": "#00ff00",

    // Top Activity Bar 
    "activityBarTop.hoverForeground": "#0000ff", 
    "activityBarTop.hoverBackground": "#ffff00" 
    } 
}
```

title: references-view: removeReferenceItem hotkey implementation
author: Clam-
body:
Resolves #234017 and #200465.

Previously ```removeReferenceItem``` did not function when utilized via hotkey. This is because the function called by the hotkey does not have the "item" to remove.  
This is resolved by iterating over the current selection and calling remove on those items in the case where no item is provided.

This can be tested by:
* Assigning a hotkey to removeReferenceItem
* Right clicking on a symbol and selecting "Find All References"
* Pressing the hotkey

title: Explorer: add `explorer.collapseResource` to collapse a specific folder (by URI) without changing focus (#261598)
author: Csabesz07
body:
## Summary
Adds two new commands `explorer.collapseResource` and `explorer.collapseResourceRecursive` that collapses a specific folder (and it's child folders with the recurscive command) in the Explorer given its resource URI, without changing focus/selection.

## Motivation
Extensions and automation need to collapse folders programmatically without UI flicker or stealing focus. Existing commands operate only on the focused element. This would allow the development of an extension which keeps the explorer tidy.

## Implementation
- Registers `explorer.collapseResource` (args: `URI`).
- Registers `explorer.collapseResourceRecursive` (args: `URI`).
- No behavior change to existing commands.

## Backwards compatibility
- New commands only; no changes to existing public commands.

## Related
Fixes #261598

title: Fix editor edge clicking
author: remcohaszing
body:
When clicking the 10 left-most pixels of the editor, the cursor was moved to the beginning of the line. When clicking the 10 right-most characters of the editor, the cursor was moved to the end of the line. This is not correct in RTL. Clicking the left pixels should move the cursor to the left. Clicking the right pixels should move the cursor to the right.

This was an oversight in #255455.

Also the `horizontalScrollPadding` is hardcoded to 10. I noticed in my own editor this means I canâ€™t put the cursor between the first two characters in VSCode. It will always snap to the beginning of the line. Should this be made configurable (in a separate PR)?

title: rewrite polling function
author: meganrogge
body:
This PR refactors the OutputMonitor polling functionality to use an event-driven approach instead of promise-based monitoring. The changes move from a `startMonitoring()` method that returns a result to one that fires events and exposes results via properties.
- Replace promise-based polling with event-driven monitoring that fires `onDidFinishCommand` events
- Restructure the constructor to automatically start monitoring and accept monitoring parameters

Enables us to easily monitor foreground terminals

title: Fix out of bounds text selection with line wrapping
author: remcohaszing
body:
The original behaviour is confusing and somewhat hard to explain. Given a Monaco editor with text wrapping enabled, if the user starts selecting text and moves the mouse outside of the editor viewbox, to the right of the screen, the cursor in the editor would be somewhere halfway the editor. The editor cursor did move with the mouse. So moving the mouse further right, moved the cursor further forward. The text cursor could even move onto the next line, below the mouse position. In case of RTL, the behaviour was the same. Further right means more forward, meaning it was visually mirrored.

The new behaviour with this PR is easier to explain. If the cursor moves out of bounds while selecting text, the selection will match the end of the wrapped line at column matching the cursor height. It also takes RTL into account.

The new behaviour matches gedit, LibreOffice, Google Docs, HTML content in browsers, and even Monaco Editor with text wrapping disabled.

title: Allow modals in automation
author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
This allows for the opt-in behavior of allowing dialogs while using automation. I went with opt-in to reduce the blast radius (our smoke tests assume dialogs don't show).

When opted in, we also switch over to using custom dialogs & the simple file picker so that the automation can control it.

This was added so that we can do auth flows, which uses dialogs. Now we will be able to complete an auth flow (with the help of the user in the browser) and automate interacting with chat via the development MCP server.

title: Fix terminal sticky scroll breaking 'tab moves focus'
author: anthonykim1
body:
Resolves: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/213925

The bug is that focus can get forever "stuck" inside terminal sticky scroll when tabbing through with setting `tab moves focus`. 

Setting the index for the sticky scroll overlay to -1 would prevent this from happening.
We'd also want to make sure clicking on terminal sticky scroll still works though hence the `hoverOverlay.style.pointerEvents = 'auto';`

title: Per-item truncation for Inlay Hints
author: jackrobertscott
body:
Added a new configuration option to the editor's inlay hints feature, allowing users to set a maximum length for each individual inlay hint item.

* Added a new `maximumItemLength` property to the `IEditorInlayHintsOptions` interface, allowing users to specify a maximum character length for each inlay hint item. Setting it to `0` disables per-item truncation.
* Modified the option parsing logic to support the new `maximumItemLength` property, ensuring it is clamped to a valid integer range.
* Updated the `InlayHintsController` to read the new `maximumItemLength` option and enforce per-item truncation when rendering hints. If a hint exceeds the configured length, it is truncated and an ellipsis is added. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a4f99ac14f20ad02a66050bc0a94bf425490341ae28bbdd690d1a7da73d1b35bR547) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a4f99ac14f20ad02a66050bc0a94bf425490341ae28bbdd690d1a7da73d1b35bR616-R630)

title: chat: use language model metadata when restoring persisted default model (fixes included models fallback)
author: parsasabetz
body:
Fixes [#262698](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262698)

Summary:
Remove hard-coded `'copilot/gpt-4.1'` special-case when restoring the persisted selected model in the Copilot chat input. The code now looks up the persisted model metadata and uses `isDefault` to determine whether the persisted selection was the default at the time of storing.

Files changed:
- `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatInputPart.ts`

Problem:
Stable builds were restoring only `copilot/gpt-4.1` as the fallback default model due to a literal string check (`persistedSelection === 'copilot/gpt-4.1'`). This prevented other included (0x) models from being restored/selected as fallback.

Change:
- Lookup the persisted model via `languageModelsService.lookupLanguageModel(...)`.
- When reading the `.isDefault` storage fallback, use the model's metadata: `persistedModel?.isDefault ?? false`.
- Preserve the existing restore logic but avoid the `copilot/gpt-4.1` hard-coded special-case.

Testing / notes:
- Local TypeScript compile check (`npm run tsec-compile-check`) completed with no errors in my environment.
- I did not run the full product compile locally (_heavy_). CI should run the full build/test matrix and catch any further issues.
- This change should be low-risk; it removes **a single** hard-coded special case and **uses existing model metadata**.

Follow-ups:
- If CI flags anything, I will iterate on the PR.
- Consider adding a small unit test for the persisted default logic if there's a unit-test surface available for `ChatInputPart` or the model restoration logic.

Reviewer notes:
- Relevant issue: [#262698](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262698)

title: Update for-in loop snippet with `Object.hasOwn()`
author: Da-nie-elT
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
Cleaner change for the For-In Loop snippets. With an early continue for 1 less indent & does not trigger [ESLint no-prototype-builtins](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-prototype-builtins)

I used `Object.hasOwn(${2:object}, ${1:key})` over `${2:object}.hasOwn(${1:key})` because the latter only showed "any" in the hover poup while the former gives the method's  documentation from the `ObjectConstructor` typescript interface.

Closes #262678

author: joshspicer
body:

ref https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/260221

When clicking the `+` to create a new coding agent session, this will lock the user into a new chat that is _not_ attached to a remote session but has the same visual elements as an attached chat.  After the first message, we forward to the extension and replace the active editor with the newly attached editor. This makes the GH coding agent flow we're looking for possible

title: Allow modals in automation
author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
This allows for the opt-in behavior of allowing dialogs while using automation. I went with opt-in to reduce the blast radius (our smoke tests assume dialogs don't show).

When opted in, we also switch over to using custom dialogs & the simple file picker so that the automation can control it.

This was added so that we can do auth flows, which uses dialogs. Now we will be able to complete an auth flow (with the help of the user in the browser) and automate interacting with chat via the development MCP server.

title: fix remote branch option for worktree creation
author: nguyenchristy
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
Fixes the detached head issue related to creating worktree from remote branch.

- Automatically creates a local branch that tracks remote branch. 
- Handles error when worktree is already used by a local branch tracking the selected remote branch by presenting options to open worktree in current/new window or cancel
- Handles error when local branch name already exists (but worktree does not), by presenting option to create new branch or cancel.

title: a11y fix: updates activity bar inactive foreground icon opacity to improve visibility
author: essjay05
body:
Changes ACTIVITY_BAR_FOREGROUND opacity to 0.5 to improve/increase the activity bar inactive icon color contrast against the activity bar background. This improves the contrast for both VSCode Light default theme and VSCode Dark default theme.


* **BEFORE Change** VSCode Light Theme: [FG + opacity] rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.4) on top of [BG] rgb(44, 44, 44) interpreted as #808080 : [BG] rgb(44, 44, 44) | [#2c2c2c](https://critique.corp.google.com/#search/&q=tag:2c2c2c) = 3.53
* **AFTER Change** VSCode Light Theme: [FG + opacity] rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5) on top of [BG] rgba(44, 44, 44) interpreted as #969696 : [BG] rgba(44, 44, 44) | [#2c2c2c](https://critique.corp.google.com/#search/&q=tag:2c2c2c) = 4.72

* **BEFORE Change** VSCode Dark Theme: [FG + opacity] rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.4) on top of [BG] rgb(51, 51, 51) interpreted as #858585 : [BG] rgb(51, 51, 51) | #333333 = 3.42
* **AFTER Change** VSCode Dark Theme: [FG + opacity] rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5) on top of [BG] rgb(51, 51, 51) interpreted as #999999 : [BG] rgb(51, 51, 51) | #333333 = 4.43

title: Wait for agent loop to finish in automation
author: rwoll
body:
Automation needs to determine when the "chat loop" has reached a terminal state so it can inspect the state of the workspace. To support this, `workbench.action.chat.open` now accepts an optional `blockOnResponse` flag (defaulting to non-blocking).

Additionally, when a terminal state is reached, automation must be able to determine the precise error that's hit. To support this, `IChatResponseErrorDetails.code` has been added. While `IChatResponseErrorDetails` has a number of flags (`isQuotaExceeded`, etc.) we do not want to formally introduce more arbitrary states to the API as flags. Instead, `code` can be used/set by a Chat Extension.

As a follow up, [`getErrorDetailsFromChatFetchError`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/32fd96c50a9044a811bf264cfa38d9e979eb99d2/src/platform/chat/common/commonTypes.ts#L263) in the Chat extension will be updated to set the new `code` field.

Co-authored-by:  Connor Peet <connor@peet.io>

## Summary

Adds option `extensions.disablePublisherTrustPrompt`, which will skip extension trust prompt and directly trust given publisher.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a47cda8b-75e2-4e00-a955-d335de4dfceb

```diff --git a/product.json b/product.json
index a0719353135..9a57362b960 100644
--- a/product.json
+++ b/product.json
@@ -33,6 +33,13 @@
 	"nodejsRepository": "https://nodejs.org",

```
